description:
But first, after 18 consecutive days of talks in Vienna and after a month of tense, detailed negotiations, a deal was finally hammered out on Monday between Iran and six world powers on curbing Iran's nuclear programme in return for the lifting of sanctions. Iran's leading negotiator was the Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif. Lyse Doucet asked him how he would characterise the deal.

"It is one of the first times in probably contemporary history when you were able to resolve a very serious, at least from their perspective, issue that has given rise to six, seven Security Council resolutions, impose all sorts of sanctions by the Security Council against Iran. And now we've been able to resolve that, or begin to resolve that without military confrontation, that shows that diplomacy can work, diplomacy can certainly prevail over threat, over coercion and can produce better results."
